title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Electric Fan Part C

content.question: Part C Refer to the graph of \(h\) in part (A). The \(t\)-coordinate of \(K\) is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of \(P\) is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C57@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about \(h\) ? \(h\) is positive and increasing. \(h\) is positive and decreasing. \(h\) is negative and increasing. \(h\) is negative and decreasing. (ii) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C57@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, describe the concavity of the graph of \(h\) and determine whether the rate of change of \(h\) is increasing or decreasing.

frqParts.text: Part C Refer to the graph of \(h\) in part (A). The \(t\)-coordinate of \(K\) is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaaaa@3829@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the \(t\)-coordinate of \(P\) is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaaaa@382A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C57@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about \(h\) ? \(h\) is positive and increasing. \(h\) is positive and decreasing. \(h\) is negative and increasing. \(h\) is negative and decreasing. (ii) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C57@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, describe the concavity of the graph of \(h\) and determine whether the rate of change of \(h\) is increasing or decreasing.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
